answers.answer: Hi, have you seen an Endocrinologist?  You have symptoms of diabetes, but I assume this has been ruled out?  The endocrine system impacts every organ in the body, and if you have a small cyst or tumor on your pancreas, thyroid, etc it can wreak havoc with your body.  Plus, have you had a colonoscopy?  There are conditions with the colon that are known to cause pain in that area. If you haven't seen a gastroenterologist, I would do this also.  I know your frustration, went thru this with my son.  But you're doing the right thing, something is wrong and it's just a matter of finding the doctor that will know.  Keep going until you have an answer. Take care...

have you seen a gastro specialist?  I had my gallbladder out six weeks ago and have the same symptoms.  I am currently being checked for Sphincter of Oddi condition.  I too have racked up many bills, only to be told they do not know why the pain is so intense.  My next step is an ERCP test to determine if I have SOD.

there is only so much it could be...diabetes,,,,pancreatitis,,,,sphincter of oddi disfunction,,did they do a ultrasound?,,ct scan with contrast?...wouldnt you sh-t if you had a simple hiatal hernia and it was never looked into!!!i get the same thing,and have been check for everything too!!!!!!!!!!!!!mine has not "flared up" for sometime,,,but i thought i had everything from pancreatitis to ulcer,,,,and im good too,,,SO THEY SAY!!since i quit drinking liquor though,ill tell you i dont get it nearly as much.still think pancreas was my issue,,,but who knows...its very hard to ell,and has to be qhecked when a actual attack is under way!!,,i know,i have a budy with chronic pancreatitis,and its not a pretty picture.please remember me and if you do ever figure out what is effecting you,let me know,id like to know what i too might be experiencing.
Weird... My very first post almost a year ago.....  It was all thyroid.

question: I have been through living hell the last three weeks.  I have racked up almost $150,000 in medical bills yet no one has figured out what is wrong with me.Right to the point:Started off with extreme thirst, frequent peeing and retention.  Back pain under right shoulder blade in one spot, and also under right rib cage that radiates to the back. The pain hurts worse when i breathe in.  Its a very bad pressure discomfort.I have had every test known to mankind including:  MRI of back and spine, Stomache scope, kidney MRI, Liver MRI, nuclear testing, multiple blood screening.I have seen every type of doctor except a neurologist.  My family doctor of 17 years has basically told me he is lost.The pain was also in my gallblatter area, but I had that removed last Saturday as it was part of this general discomfort.  They did lab work on the gallblatter to find out it was inflamed, but not diseased.  All doctors agree that whatever this is going on, was also causing discomfort.  Half of them say its muscular skeletel, the others say its not.  Someone thought Shingles, but i have no other symptoms except the pressure and discomfort.I am a 42 year old guy, 5'10 170, work out every day until 3 weeks ago when my life fell apart.  As I type this I can feel pressure under my right rib cage and also pain in about a 3 by 3 area under my rib cage.It is NOT diabetes, pancreatitits, gallblatter (anymore), muscle tear, bulging disc, reflux, injury.  However I do feel like someone beat the **** out of me with a bat yesterday and i just work up from a mugging.Does anyone have any clue on what the heck is happening to me and why i have so much discomfort?Bruce in Dallas
title: Mystery diagnosis pains
